main event: The observer reported seeing a bright, blueish-white, round object over Colorado Springs, Colorado that appeared to be extremely large and bright.
interesting points: The object was observed for approximately 30 minutes and moved in an erratic manner at various altitudes.
The observer estimated the object to be 5-6 miles away and covering about 1/3 to 1/4 of the field of view when measured against a match stick.
The object did not make any sound and had no visible exhaust or propulsion system.
The observer had previously reported seeing a similar object in the same area on December 19, 1960.
No other reports were received by the military or civil authorities regarding this sighting.
sighted object: A large, bright, blueish-white, round object
